abstract: Labor Dept reports Consumer Price Index rose 0.2 percent in February 2015, after dropping 0.7 percent in January, signaling that inflation may be stabilizing; Commerce Dept reports that sales of new homes in February achieved fastest pace in seven years.
lead_paragraph: Broad gains in other categories also contributed to the gain, the first in four months.

headline.main: Rising Gas Costs Help Lift U.S. Consumer Prices
headline.print_headline: Gas Prices Rise Slightly, and New-Home Sales Jump

snippet: Broad gains in other categories also contributed to the gain, the first in four months.
